intro: Calliandra dysantha var. turbinata, commonly known as the turban acacia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery, pink to red inflorescences that resemble a turban, hence its common name. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. The species is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in agricultural settings.
